panels.visual: Theotomere vanishes into the textile stalls, swallowed by hanging silks and the press of bodies, clutching his wounded side. One moment there, the next simply gone. Guards begin shouting in the distance.
panels.narration: He turned and vanished into the textile stalls as if he had never been.

panels.visual: Sadia stands at the mouth of an alley, hand on a sword-hilt worn smooth with use. Bracers gleam on her forearms. Everything about her speaks of someone who knows the better end of a blade. She gestures urgently.
panels.dialogue: Sadia: "With me! With me, fools, or do you prefer the dungeon?"

panels.visual: Wide shot of the group running through the gates, out of the city and into the sprawling caravan encampment. Cook-fires flicker in the gathering dusk. A fire-swallower performs for children. The great tent of Hind rises in the distance, its guy-ropes strung with bells.
panels.narration: Through the gates they plunged, out of the city proper and into the sprawling encampment of a caravan.
